_v.en: Woe to the defrauders, who use short measures,

_v.ar: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ٱكْتَالُوا۟ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَسْتَوْفُونَ
_v.en: who, when they measure [a commodity bought] from the people, take the full measure,
but diminish when they measure or weigh for them.
Do they not know that they will be resurrected
on a tremendous day,
a day when mankind will stand before the Lord of all the worlds?

_v.ar: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلْفُجَّارِ لَفِى سِجِّينٍ
_v.en: Indeed, the record of the vicious is in Sijjeen.
And what will show you what is Sijjeen?
It is a written record.
Woe to the deniers on that day,
who deny the Day of Retribution;

_v.ar: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦٓ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعْتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ
_v.en: and none denies it except every sinful transgressor.

_v.ar: إِذَا تُتْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ ءَايَـٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
_v.en: When Our signs are recited to him, he says, ‘Myths of the ancients!’

_v.ar: كَلَّا ۖ بَلْ ۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يَكْسِبُونَ
_v.en: No, that is not the case! Rather, their hearts have been sullied by what they have been earning.

_v.ar: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُمْ عَن رَّبِّهِمْ يَوْمَئِذٍ لَّمَحْجُوبُونَ
_v.en: Indeed, they will be alienated from their Lord on that day.
Afterward they will enter hell,

_v.ar: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَـٰذَا ٱلَّذِى كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ
_v.en: then told, ‘This is what you used to deny!’

_v.ar: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَـٰبَ ٱلْأَبْرَارِ لَفِى عِلِّيِّينَ
_v.en: Indeed, the record of the pious is in Illeeyun.
And what will show you what is Illeeyun?
It is a written record,
witnessed by those brought near [to Allah].
The pious shall be amid bliss,
observing, [as they recline] on couches.
You will perceive in their faces the freshness of bliss.
They will be served with a sealed pure wine,

_v.ar: خِتَـٰمُهُۥ مِسْكٌ ۚ وَفِى ذَٰلِكَ فَلْيَتَنَافَسِ ٱلْمُتَنَـٰفِسُونَ
_v.en: whose seal is musk—for such let the viers vie—
and whose seasoning is from Tasneem,
a spring where those brought near [to Allah] drink.

_v.ar: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجْرَمُوا۟ كَانُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ يَضْحَكُونَ
_v.en: Indeed the guilty used to laugh at the faithful,
and when they passed them by they would wink at each other,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓا۟ إِلَىٰٓ أَهْلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُوا۟ فَكِهِينَ
_v.en: and when they returned to their folks they would return amused,

_v.ar: وَإِذَا رَأَوْهُمْ قَالُوٓا۟ إِنَّ هَـٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَضَآلُّونَ
_v.en: and when they saw them they would say, ‘Indeed those are the astray!’
Though they were not sent to watch over them.

_v.ar: فَٱلْيَوْمَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ مِنَ ٱلْكُفَّارِ يَضْحَكُونَ
_v.en: So today the faithful will laugh at the faithless,
observing from their couches:

_v.ar: هَلْ ثُوِّبَ ٱلْكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُوا۟ يَفْعَلُونَ
_v.en: Have the faithless been requited for what they used to do?
